programme.title: Wildest India: Thar Desert: Sacred Sands
programme.desc: Covering 200,000 km sq, India's Thar desert is one of the harshest places on Earth. Desiccating winds and near permanent drought has earned this unforgiving land another name: the region of death.

programme.title: Wildest Africa: Madagascar: Islands of Monsters
programme.desc: Madagascar is truly a weird and wonderful land. Isolated on an island of extreme and magical looking locations, life has adapted and diversified. With few predators, numbers have proliferated and natural selection has gone mad.

programme.title: Wildest Africa: Zambezi: Wild Water
programme.desc: The Zambezi is one of Africa's most influential rivers. It supports some of the continent's most spectacular wildlife. However, the Zambezi's long and winding journey destroys, as well as creates.

programme.title: Wildest Africa: Mount Kenya: African Heart of Ice
programme.desc: Mount Kenya soars over 5km into the air. It is the second highest mountain in Africa. At its summit, temperatures fluctuate from over 30 degrees celsius to below freezing.

programme.title: Wildest Africa: Ngorongoro: Born of Fire
programme.desc: Ngorongoro is thought to have formed about 2.5 million years ago from a large volcano, whose cone collapsed inward after a major eruption. This fertile land is full of wildlife, from cunning hyena and proud lions to vast herds of wildebeest and elephants.

programme.title: George And The Dragon
programme.desc: A knight (James Purefoy, "Rome") returning from the Crusades takes on a dragon after the disappearance of the kindly Princess Lunna (Piper Perabo, "Coyote Ugly"). With Patrick Swayze.

programme.title: Jackie Brown
programme.desc: Writer and director Quentin Tarantino adapts Elmore Leonard's bestseller RUM PUNCH in a stylish homage to 1970s exploitation movies with six players on the trail of a half-million dollars in cash.

programme.title: The Forbidden Kingdom
programme.desc: Two highly skilled martial arts warriors must train an American teen so that he is able to fight a centuries old battle to free the Monkey King.

programme.title: The Phantom Planet
programme.desc: When US astronaut Captain Frank Chapman’s military spaceship is damaged by asteroids, he lands safely on the giant asteroid Rheton.

programme.title: Swamp Diamonds
programme.desc: An undercover police woman infiltrates a group of hardened female criminals who plan to break out of prison and retrieve diamonds from a swamp.

programme.title: Last Of The Wild Horses

programme.title: The Killer Shrews

programme.title: Deadly Women: Senseless Slayings
programme.desc: When a person places no value on human life, they can become unstoppable in their twisted missions to destroy the lives around them. These women all pushed boundaries, and shattered lives with their actions.

programme.title: Deadly Women: Loathe Thy Neighbor
programme.desc: Neighbors can be a source of friendship and community comfort. But what happens when a neighbor stops watching out for you, and starts watching you. The sinister minds of these women begin to turn sour and they begin to torment their neighbors.

programme.title: Deadly Women: Breaking Point
programme.desc: Anger, fear and despair are basic human emotions. But when these emotions are coupled with a broken mind, a perfect storm is created. Teetering on the edge of unbalance, these women resort to murder when pushed to the breaking point.

programme.title: Deadly Women: Match Made For Murder
programme.desc: When a woman wants more from her husband than he can give, marriage can be a dangerous union. For these deadly women, relationships mean nothing more than a match made for murder.

programme.title: Deadly Women
programme.desc: These deadly women were consumed by obsessions that overtook their minds and their lives. These women all had a fatal fixation.

programme.title: The FBI Files: Deadly Trail
programme.desc: The disappearance of young women triggered a search that spanned the Pacific Northwest. A massive media campaign failed to locate the drifter, who first charmed then killed them. As investigators followed his trail, he always stayed one step ahead.

programme.title: The FBI Files: The Murdering Cowboy
programme.desc: The sun set on the Wild West long ago, but some people refused to notice. Claude Dallas was one of them. A wily trapper, Dallas typified the rugged individualism that forged this country. He went too far when he killed two game wardens in 1981.

programme.title: The FBI Files: Evil Intent
programme.desc: Drops of blood and a torn screen were all that's left to tell authorities what happened to a woman in Indiana. The 21 yr. old victim was taken from her home on a spring morning. She appeared to have no real enemies, there was no clear motive.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Bank robbery is a brazen yet simple crime. A mask, a gun, a note passed to a teller. But bank burglary is different. It takes skill to disable an alarm, to penetrate a locked vault.

programme.title: The Brady Bunch: Cyrano De Brady
programme.desc: Peter has a crush on Jan's new friend but every plan to impress her backfires. Inspired by "Cyrano de Bergerac", he launches a final plan to win her over with Greg's help but it also backfires when she falls for Greg instead.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: The Set-Up
programme.desc: The trail is hot and the stakes is high for Dog and the posse. The "Big Fish" in this case is Marco, an alleged drug dealer with a big bond. But a major key to catching him is Elizabeth, who is also a fugitive from the law.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: New Dog in Town
programme.desc: It's Beth's birthday and Dog knows just what she needs. He surprises Beth with Delilah, a puppy small enough to sit in the palm of her hand. Beth is so happy that she insists on taking the puppy with her on today's bounty.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Reality Check
programme.desc: Dog is back in Denver and in hot pursuit of a woman wanted for identity theft. The sad reality is that the identify which has been robbed is her own. She's traded in a bright future for a life on the wrong side of the law.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Picture This
programme.desc: A fugitive with a long criminal record has fled to Hawaii, and the bondsman on the mainland has asked Dog for help. Dog doesn't have much information to work with, but he can use the felon's desire to impress his friends to track him down.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: The Comeback Kid
programme.desc: Dog is back in Colorado chasing a young man with a taste for trouble. He's fled to Texas but with his family's house on the line Dog is willing to try a risky strategy.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Behind the Hunt
programme.desc: The cameras are turned around, as we get a tour of life "behind the scenes" on Dog the Bounty Hunter. Using interviews with Dog and the posse, the TV crew, and never before seen footage, this is one of most revealing and heartfelt episodes of the series.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: True Identity
programme.desc: Dog knows that looks can be deceiving. The fugitive is pretty, petite, and trouble. She stands accused of settling an argument with the help of a box cutter. What Dog does not anticipate is how deceptive this femme fatale can truly be!

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Rock-a-Bye Bounty
programme.desc: Dog and Beth must go after their former housekeeper, Lisa, who's jumped bond. They know this case will be tricky because Lisa knows everyone in the family. Luckily, Beth's nephew, Jason, is visiting and is quickly put to work as the bait.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Spring Pong Cleaning
programme.desc: After Korie decides the junk piles in the Duck Commander warehouse are beginning to reach critical mass, she calls on Willie and the guys to do a little company spring-cleaning.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Good Morning, West Monroe
programme.desc: After attending a local radio show as a guest, Willie sees an opportunity to host a show of his own.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Of Mattresses and Men
programme.desc: The Jase, Si and the guys from the duck call room take a field trip to a brand new local donut shop and quickly find out who amongst them can eat the most delicious treats.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Samurai Si
programme.desc: Willie receives a special gift from a Japanese business associate - a "priceless" samurai sword, which Willie keeps out of the hands of Jase and the guys.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Duck No, We Won't Go
programme.desc: Willie pushes his work force too far after implementing new "motivational work tactics," and the guys rise up against him and go on strike.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Drag Me To Glory
programme.desc: When NASCAR sensation Clint Bowyer pays a visit to the Duck Commander warehouse, Willie and the guys are fired up to spend the day hanging out with the professional racecar driver.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Duck Season Eve
programme.desc: Tomorrow is the opening day of Duck Season and the men are carrying on their tradition of camping on the Robertson Land the night before.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Can't Hardly Weight
programme.desc: Gearing up for his high school reunion, Willie realizes that he could stand to lose a few pounds. Jase and Korie set out to help him drop some weight and the strenuous battle of man-versus-waistline begins.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Shot Thru The Heart
programme.desc: The guys learn from Willie that John Luke is going through his first break up. In order to make him feel better the men decide to take John Luke hunting for nutria, and impart their relationship wisdom.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Here Lizard, Lizard
programme.desc: When the warehouse guys new office pet (a lizard) escapes, they try all they can in order to catch the wily reptile. Proving impossible, the guys finally decide to bring in the big guns to help trap it--Mr. Phil Robertson.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Hallu-Si-Nations
programme.desc: With Willie out-of-town, the guys decide to flake off work and leave to brush up the duck blinds on the Robertson land. While out, Si believes he spots what he thinks is the infamous 'Black Panther'.

programme.title: Drug Wars: Episode 17
programme.desc: Mexican Cartels exploit an old migrant route, thick with brush, to traffic drugs across the Rio Grande. Plus, in Nogales Arizona, law enforcement works round the clock to counter traffickers’ endlessly inventive techniques for smuggling drugs

programme.title: Drug Wars: Episode 18
programme.desc: Custom and Border Protection officers in the Port of Miami are on high alert over a resurgence of cocaine smuggling. In the port, officers search a suspicious cargo container after the X-Ray unit spots an anomaly inside

programme.title: Drug Wars: Woman on a Mission
programme.desc: On this episode of Drug Wars, we take you on an exclusive journey into the heart of Guatemala, where the war on drugs has taken a surprising turn.

programme.title: Drug Wars: The Cocaine Vacuum
programme.desc: Cocaine production is surging, and law enforcement is ready to fight back. Colombian special forces units venture deep into FARC territory to locate and destroy a cocaine lab.

programme.title: Drug Wars: The Walk to Freedom
programme.desc: Hundreds of migrants try to enter the US every day. Some are forced to work as drug mules, with many perishing during the harsh desert crossing.

programme.title: Drug Wars: Bricks in the Wall
programme.desc: Arrests spike along the border wall as residents of India and Pakistan leap over, right into the hands of the border patrol. Other teams investigate new smuggling tunnels

programme.title: Drug Wars: Quezon City Slum
programme.desc: The war against illegal drug trafficking heats up in the Philippines. The Quezon City police are on high alert as hundreds of cops carry out a massive anti-narcotics operation in this Manila slum

programme.title: Jail: Permission to Panhandle
programme.desc: An arrested panhandler wants to buy a permit for panhandling.

programme.title: Jail: Stripper Hygienist
programme.desc: A man is placed in a side cell and a trans woman shares her story.

programme.title: Jail: Toothless Tears
programme.desc: A difficult inmate blames his behavior on various medical conditions.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Brexit
programme.desc: Over 17 years of marriage Leon has had countless affairs with other women and Siobhan has had it. She claims all he wants is for her to keep his house clean and pick up after him. Leon argues that the problems stem from Siobhan’s bad drinking habits.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Family Guy
programme.desc: Jazmin's final straw was when Darren brought another woman over and lied about Jazmin being his sister and his daughter being his niece. Darren feels he's a good father who pays the bills and doesn't need to answer to anyone if he's not married.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Sick and Tired
programme.desc: Timothy is tired of being kicked out the house every time Erin catches an attitude. If she kicks him out once more, he's gone for good. Erin says she dropped out of college and left behind a full tennis scholarship because of him.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Grumpy Old Man
programme.desc: Michaela and Richard’s 30-year age difference has finally taken a toll on their relationship. Richard says he just wants to settle down and enjoy the rest of his life and says that Michaela’s constant nagging is making him rethink marrying her.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Heart Break Hotel
programme.desc: Brianna says Steven constantly looks at other women behind her back which has taken a toll on her confidence. He says her overprotectiveness leads to arguments that end up with her accusing him of cheating.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Nana Bread
programme.desc: Markia says Herb's overactive sex drive is ruining their relationship because he wants it daily. When Herb doesn't get his way, he throws major tantrums. Can Herb learn to take breathers or has this 11 year relationship taking its toll?

programme.title: Divorce Court: Firecracker
programme.desc: Gary claims Ebony's verbally abusive, acts like a dictator and is frustrated with her disrespectful comments. She loves Gary very much and claims to be a 'ride or die' girlfriend, but is over Gary's unmotivated, stuck in the mud ways.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Poker Face
programme.desc: Tamika and Joseph have been together 7 years before marrying, but now his gambling addiction plus their new baby has worn the two out. Joseph’s excessive gambling habits are draining their life’s savings and he refuses to get the help he needs.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Players Club
programme.desc: When this couple met on the internet, they instantly hit it off. Though, when Ray found out Raina was creating sexy videos for pay, he wasn’t so keen. He believes that she is meeting up with her followers and having relations for more money.

programme.title: Paranormal State: Man of the House

programme.title: Paranormal State: Pet Cemetery

programme.title: Paranormal State: Haunted Homecoming

programme.title: Most Haunted: Wentworth Woodhouse Part 1

programme.title: Most Haunted: Wentworth Woodhouse Part 2
programme.desc: Part 2. The underbelly of this great house is a sharp contrast to its upper grandeur. Some members of the team are forced to run while other are lost in the labyrinth of tunnels and passageways pursued by something unnatural.

programme.title: Most Haunted: 30 East Drive_PT1

programme.title: Most Haunted: 30 East Drive_PT2
programme.desc: The team continue their most threatening investigation yet and for some they will be scared for life mentally and physically. The most violent poltergeist in the world is ready for a fight...but who wins?

programme.title: Most Haunted: Armley Mills

programme.title: Most Haunted: Black Country Living Museum

programme.desc: Steven has a hard time accepting that Jennifer is growing up.

programme.title: Family Ties: Once in Love With Elyse
programme.desc: Elyse’s coworker tells her that he’s in love with her.

programme.title: Moesha: A Den Is A Terrible Thing To Waste
programme.desc: A well-intentioned Moesha intervenes to try and stop her once-popular hangout, The Den, from being sold to a commercial developer, unaware that Andell stands to make a great deal of money on its sale.

programme.title: Moesha: Isn’t She Lovely?
programme.desc: Hakeem and Moesha’s friendship takes an interesting turn after he surprises her with an expensive necklace to wear to a homecoming dance she’s attending with someone else.

programme.title: Moesha: Unappreciated Interest
programme.desc: Dorian pulls an illegal scam involving Frank’s credit card and makes matters worse by lying about it, behavior that could have dramatic consequences.

programme.title: Moesha: Thanksgiving
programme.desc: With Dee sick in bed with a bad cold, Moesha offers to prepare the Thanksgiving feast but finds herself engaged in a fierce cooking competition with Hakeem’s mother.

programme.title: Moesha: To Sleep – Perchance To Dream
programme.desc: Moesha starts having recurring romantic dreams about Hakeem, giving her second thoughts about their friendship and about sharing a room with him and Niecy on an upcoming ski trip.

programme.title: Moesha: He Doth Protest Too Much
programme.desc: Moesha discovers that some of her college classes are more difficult than she thought; she has a hard time in Chemistry and reluctantly agrees to let Niecy tutor her.

programme.title: Moesha: Let’s Talk About Sex
programme.desc: Moesha crashes in Niecy’s dorm room after a late-night Pendulum party and is horrified to discover that Nicey has also let a male sleep in the room.

programme.title: Moesha: Secrets and Lies
programme.desc: The arrival of Frank’s Aunt Hattie brings a shocking revelation about Frank that turns the rest of the family – especially Dorian and Moesha – against him.

programme.title: Moesha: Color Him Father
programme.desc: Still reeling from the news that Frank is Dorian’s biological father, the Mitchells prepare for Dorian’s 17th birthday bash, a party that grows more and more elaborate and expensive as Dorian takes full advantage of Frank’s guilt.

programme.title: Moesha: Family Affair
programme.desc: Still angry at Frank for keeping his true relationship to Dorian a secret for so long, Moesha decides not to introduce her father at an upcoming 'Businessman of the Year' awards banquet.

programme.title: Location, Location, Location: Hampshire
programme.desc: They've got a sailor looking for his first home and a soldier who's about to be made homeless.

programme.title: Location, Location, Location: North Surrey
programme.desc: This week Kirstie and Phil take charge of property searches for 2 couples who hope to relocate to the leafy streets of beautiful Surrey –one of the most expensive counties in the country.

programme.title: Location, Location, Location: Yorkshire & Guildford
programme.desc: After winning one point eight million on the lottery, they needed a new house.

programme.title: Location, Location, Location: East Midlands
programme.desc: Kirstie and Phil are back and busier than ever, as they attempt to find homes for two sets of house hunters with very different needs in an extremely challenging market.

programme.title: Location, Location, Location: Edinburgh Revisit
programme.desc: A year ago, Kirstie and I were pounding the streets of Edinburgh. I've come back to see if all the hard work was worth it.

programme.title: Dynasty: Blake's Blindness
programme.desc: Blake remains blinded following the explosion; Nick asks Krystle to divorce her husband and marry him; Blake investigates Nick's past; Alexis is determined to drive Krystle from Denver.

programme.title: Dynasty: The Hearing
programme.desc: Fallon confesses her love to Nick, but he is interested in Krystle; Blake's attempts to bring gangster Logan Rhinewood before a Crime Committee hearing are thwarted; Sammy Jo tells Alexis she knows her secret; Blake receives an anonymous letter.

programme.title: Dynasty: The Iago Syndrome
programme.desc: Krystle says goodbye to Nick and leaves Denver; Blake offers to adopt Jeff; Cecil blackmails Claudia; Nick accepts Blake's explanation of his brother's death.

programme.title: Dynasty: The Party
programme.desc: At a party in her honor, Sammy Jo embarrasses the Carringtons and reveals to Fallon that Blake is not her father; Jeff leaves the party with Claudia; Blake tells Krystle his eyesight is restored; Fallon is left unconscious after a car accident.

programme.title: Dynasty: The Baby
programme.desc: Fallon gives birth to a son; Alexis offers Sammy Jo $25,000 to leave Denver; Jeff and Claudia make love; Krystle accuses Alexis of killing her baby; Alexis learns Krystle and Blake are not legally married.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.142
programme.desc: Man sues mother of his child for selling his Baby Pac-Man game; she counters for harassment, alleging cheating. Man claims ex's obsession forced him to move; she sues for unpaid rent, electric bill.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.28
programme.desc: Denying they sold their friends a lemon, a man and his fiancée sue for slander and harassment/A black Labrador bites an 8-year-old in the face; the child’s mother sues a friend for the cost of plastic surgery to repair the wound.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.187
programme.desc: A man sacrifices his job and house to move for his girlfriend but faces a broken lease and ring dispute after their breakup. Another man is sued by his child's grandmother for allegedly vandalizing her Chrysler Sebring.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.131
programme.desc: Man sued by parents after second wife's mysterious death and $40,000 life insurance policy; alleged child abuse involved/Man calls cops to remove ex-girlfriend from apartment, sues her for rent after she leaves, fearing for his life.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.31
programme.desc: The emotional burial of a pet Chihuahua leads to a violent, bloody assault between family members/A woman sues her ex-fiancé for a loan to buy a home. He claims she wrecked his truck while driving drunk, so he’s not paying.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.97
programme.desc: A woman accuses her ex-roommate-to-be of stealing her security deposit; she is countersued for rent and money owed/A 21st birthday celebration ends with a young woman allegedly wrapping a borrowed car around a pole.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.110
programme.desc: Custody of a beautiful, homemade baptismal gown is disputed by entranged family members/While driving with her five children in the car, a woman runs a red light, is arrested and is later sued by her uncle who claims he bailed her out.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.239
programme.desc: A landlord fights with tenants over a new motorcycle ignition, a damaged helmet, and an insurance bill; he countersues for unpaid rent and utilities. A young woman goes after her former roommate and his girlfriend for rent and a security deposit.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.64
programme.desc: A woman claims she was doused with lighter fluid during an argument with her ex-roommate; he claims she had him falsely arrested and countersues for return of belongings.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.146
programme.desc: A man denies popping the tires and smashing the truck windows of his ex-girlfriend’s new boyfriend’s vehicle in a jealous rampage. Ex-lovers accuse each other of having drug problems during a fight over an alleged loan for a motorcycle.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.120
programme.desc: A woman and her teen daughter accuse an estranged relative of assaulting them at a family party/A woman is suing her former friend for repossessing her truck; her friend argues that the vehicle was never insured.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Mega Cities
programme.desc: Mega Cities provide a bustling home to populations of over 10 million. Travel from the high-density living of Shanghai and Bangkok to the sprawling cities of Delhi and Mexico City, each the backdrop for dynamic cultures.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Lost Cities
programme.desc: Once powerful and populous centers of influence, these lost cities are providing clues to how our ancestors existed in the world and remind us that ancient civilizations were not so far removed from our own.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Forest Animals
programme.desc: Forest Animals gets up close with bears, koalas, moose, wolves, weaver ants, and Tasmanian Devils. This episode roves dark forests floors and soars above vast canopies of green in America, China, Laos, and Australia.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Mountains
programme.desc: The earth’s fragile crust has folded and faulted, and nowhere are these natural forces more evident than in the world’s great mountains. Explore the highest peaks of the world’s terrain - the rugged realm between heaven and earth.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Global Cities
programme.desc: Travel to the centers of wealth, power, industry, and innovation. From London to Tokyo, Hong Kong to New York, these are the cities that never sleep. The influence held in these economic hubs unites the global community.

programme.title: Arthur: Sue Ellen Moves In/The Perfect Brother
programme.desc: A new girl has arrived in town and no one knows anything about her. And judging by the strange things happening at her house no one wants to know. Then, it's great having a friend spend the weekend.

programme.title: Arthur: Popular Girls/Buster's Growing Grudge
programme.desc: Sue Ellen and Fern take a popularity quiz in a magazine and change their personalities to become more likable, but it backfires. And Buster's convinced that his great joke will be the difference between a successful oral report and failure.

programme.title: Arthur: The Contest/Prove It
programme.desc: What would happen if Arthur and his friends entered a contest to write stories for their favorite TV show? Then, look out world, D.W. has discovered science! But D.W.'s new-found passion proves that a little knowledge is a dangerous thing.

programme.title: Arthur: Arthur Meets Mister Rogers/Draw!
programme.desc: Mister Rogers is staying at Arthur's house! Mister Rogers is a nice guy, but... his show is for babies! Can Arthur hide the visit from his friends? Next, the trouble starts when Fern draws a not-too-flattering cartoon of Francine.

programme.title: Arthur: Carl's Concerto/Too Much of a Good Thing
programme.desc: Carl has agreed to play the accordion for George's puppet show. But his routines are getting in the way of rehearsals. Buster enlists Binky's help to keep him from gorging on delicious Tuvaluna cookies. Will Buster's self-control crumble?

programme.title: Arthur: The Chips Are Down/Revenge Of The Chip
programme.desc: What a mysterious, beautiful thing a green potato chip is--and D.W. just ate a gigantic one! But then she hears a rumor that they're poisonous...Sure, kids do some pretty embarrassing things, but do Moms have to tell everyone?

programme.title: Arthur: Arthur The Wrecker/Arthur and The True Francine
programme.desc: Arthur always seems to wreck things, and this time it's Mom's computer. Can he get it fixed before Mom finds out? Then, Muffy A. Crosswire and Francine are absolute best friends, despite their rather obvious differences.

programme.title: Arthur: Buster Isn't Buying It/One Ornery Critter
programme.desc: Aliens, conspiracy theories, the megatoad--Buster believes in everything, until his favorite show gets cancelled for false reporting. Dogs love Arthur! Well, except Carrot Cake. Can Arthur win over this picky pup?

programme.title: Arthur: Arthur Makes A Movie/Go To Your Room!
programme.desc: Too young to see a real "James Hound" movie, the kids decide they'll make a film of their own. Next, how would YOU like to be four years old and completely misunderstood by your parents? And then be sent to your room for ten whole minutes?

programme.title: NEW: Nazi Collaborators: The Croatian Collaborator
programme.desc: Croatia grapples with its fascist past through figures like Dinko Sakic, once hailed as a hero but later convicted of war crimes. Leading the notorious Jasenovac camp, Sakic oversaw brutal atrocities against inmates.

programme.title: NEW: Nazi Collaborators: The Belgian Collaborator
programme.desc: Leon Degrelle, a charismatic Belgian leader, joined the Nazis and led Die Wallonien on the Eastern Front. Despite no military background, he earned the Knight's Cross for valor. He recruited 4000 more for the SS, defending Berlin until April 1945.

programme.title: NEW: Nazi Collaborators: Traitor-in-Chief
programme.desc: Pierre Laval, once celebrated and later reviled, faced execution in 1945 for collaboration with the Nazis during Vichy France. Originally a socialist and pacifist, he fell into collaboration for power and to navigate the horrors of occupation.

programme.title: NEW: Nazi Collaborators: Hitler's Inside Man
programme.desc: Chaim Rumkowski, leader of the Lodz ghetto during WWII, believed cooperation with the Nazis could save lives, providing labor in exchange for food. This approach kept some semblance of community and culture alive amidst unimaginable horror.

programme.title: Hitler's Last Secrets: Fatal Liaison - The Strange Affair of Adolf and Eva
programme.desc: The protracted romance between Adolf Hitler and Eva Braun began in 1929 and ended in 1945 in the bunker under the ruins of the Chancellery.

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Lauren & Derek
programme.desc: Lauren met Derek online years ago. Derek is caring, supporting Lauren after she had a baby with a former boyfriend. Lauren thinks Derek could be the one, so why has he avoided meeting her? (S2, ep4)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Lucille & Kidd Cole
programme.desc: Lucille led a simple life until she was asked to work for music producer Kidd Cole. Companies were never paid and one day Kidd couldn't be found. Will she get the answers she needs? (S3, ep4)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show
programme.desc: After months of intimate texts with Titus, a man she met online, Candice has decided to tell to her husband. But before she does, she asks Nev to help her find out who Titus really is! (S5, ep16)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show
programme.desc: Catfish is going international with a trip to the UK! Nev and Max meet Spencer who's been holding on to a secret for six years: he's in a relationship with a global pop star! (S5, ep15)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Nick & Melissa
programme.desc: Nick and Melissa fell in love at age 12 when they met on an online chat room. Now 18, Nick is ready to meet Melissa. But is Melissa the real deal or has Nick been entangled in lies? (S2, ep13)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show
programme.desc: Tyreme met the beautiful Tomorrow online over 9 months ago. Tyreme is ready to uproot his life to be with her. Will Nev and Max be able help Tyreme finally meet his Tomorrow? (S5, ep9)

programme.title: Jersey Shore: And the Wall Won
programme.desc: After causing drama between Ronnie & Sammi for years, The Situation comes to blows with Ronnie. But with The Situation carried out on a stretcher, have things finally gone too far? (S4, ep5)

programme.title: Jersey Shore: Fist Pump, Pushups, Chapstick
programme.desc: Pauly D and Vinny put on a Guido-themed comedy show, while Ron and Sammi try to patch things up. Snooki is so distraught over her long-distance relationship that JWOWW and Sammi decide to intervene.

programme.title: Jersey Shore: Meatball Mashup
programme.desc: S4, Ep 7. When the roommates take a trip to the Italian Shore, Snooki & Deena party so hard they wind up in bed together. Whilst back in Florence, Team Meatball has a run-in with the Italian police.

programme.title: Jersey Shore: Family Vacation: Jewish Barbie
programme.desc: Mike competes in a burger-eating contest, Nicole takes a pregnancy test, and history repeats itself when Ronnie gets into hot water (literally) with another woman.

programme.title: Jersey Shore: Family Vacation: Pork Roll or Taylor Ham?
programme.desc: The roommates come up with an elaborate scheme to kidnap Deena and bring her to the house, while newly single Ronnie takes time to himself to come to terms with his breakup.

programme.title: Ex on the Beach
programme.desc: A smoking-hot Ex arrives to shake up the villa and upset the applecart. Jordan goes after Chloe and Marty seeks comfort elsewhere, which leads to a clash of the Geordies. (S7, ep3)

programme.title: The Love Boat: The Next Step / Life Begins At 40 / The Stimulation Of Stephanie
programme.desc: A college professor (Dick Martin) turns the Love Boat into a laboratory to test the romantic responses of his lovely female student (Char Fontane).

programme.title: The Love Boat: Happy Ending / We Three / April's Love
programme.desc: A tantalizing entertainer (Charo) receives some unwanted advice on love from members of the crew, who don't approve of her marriage plans.

programme.title: Melrose Place: Friends And Lovers
programme.desc: (S01E002) Billy and Alison work out the essential boundaries of their new roommate relationship. (TV-PG)

programme.title: Melrose Place: Lost & Found
programme.desc: (S01E003) It's time to read between the lines when Billy entrusts Alison with his particularly bad screenplay, and a daring Jane loses her wedding ring during a wild night at Shooters.

programme.title: Melrose Place: For Love or Money
programme.desc: (S01E004) Alison suspects that Rick, one of the guys from mailroom, is interested in her. Jake takes a job at a coffeehouse, making espresso. (TV-PG)

programme.title: Melrose Place: Leap Of Faith
programme.desc: (S01E005) Jane receives some breathtaking, life-changing information, while Billy attempts a death-defying stunt in order to have an "experience" to write about.

programme.title: Melrose Place: My Way
programme.desc: (S01E006) Appearances can be deceiving when Billy invites Alison to meet his parents in Palm Springs, and Sandy lets a role in a horror movie go to her head.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Jeff’s New Friend
programme.desc: Jeff is surprised when Audrey informs him that the new friend he made at the gym is gay. Meanwhile, Russell worries the young woman he's dating might be his daughter.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Voluntary Commitment
programme.desc: After a long line of female assistants, Russell learns that having a male assistant can be very advantageous. Meanwhile, after volunteering to read to the elderly, Audrey makes a bet with Jeff that she can commit to finishing a project.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Dad's Visit
programme.desc: Much to Audrey's dismay, Jeff's chauvinist father, who expects Audrey to wait on him hand and foot, extends his visit after spraining his ankle. Meanwhile, Russell has a one-night stand with a woman who won't leave his apartment.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Russell's Secret
programme.desc: Audrey discovers that Russell is a closeted fan of Broadway musicals, a fact she promises to keep secret in exchange for free theater tickets. Meanwhile, Adam and Jennifer take dancing lessons in preparation for their wedding.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Twice
programme.desc: When Audrey becomes jealous of a pregnant co-worker, she inadvertently convinces her colleagues that she has a bundle of joy on the way too.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Lyin' King
programme.desc: Things quickly get complicated when Audrey and Jeff decide to ditch a dinner date with Jennifer and Adam in order to attend Brad and Jackie's exclusive, celebrity packed party.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Family Style
programme.desc: When Audrey plans a dinner date with Jeff, Jackie (Guest Star Sam Harris) and Brad (Guest Star Orlando Jones), Jeff feels extremely violated when Jackie begins eating off his plate!

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Sex Toy Story
programme.desc: When Jennifer and Audrey throw a 'girls only' sex party, Jeff quickly gets insecure when he finds a 'product' Audrey may have purchased.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: House Money
programme.desc: When Jennifer and Russell decide to teach Adam a lesson in responsibility, the joke is on them when Adam has the last laugh.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: May Divorce Be With You
programme.desc: When Audrey invites her and Jeff's recently divorced out of luck friend Steve to stay with them for a few days, Audrey thinks she may have become Steve's newest rebound.

programme.desc: Season finale. Chloe and Jordan throw their first party, Mia and Amber make a fresh start, Megan suspects Dylan is hiding something and Sassi goes all out to win back her man! (S3, ep8)

programme.desc: Emotions run high for Amber, Chloe has a Mother's Day from hell, Sassi and Darren try and repair their relationship while Dylan's friendship with another girl has tipped Megan over the edge. (S4, ep1)

programme.desc: Sassi attends an anger management course. Ste hits a low point as he upsets both Amber and Kirsty. Shannon decides to rekindle an old romance and Chloe and Jordan welcome a new addition. (S4, ep2)

programme.desc: Sassi tries to stay calm on a romantic getaway. Amber gives Ste the cold shoulder. Sleep-deprived Chloe questions if getting a puppy was a good idea. Shannon resits her GCSEs. (S4, ep3)

programme.desc: Sassi is a woman on a mission as she starts her new job. Shannon heads to the seaside where Charlie's wandering eye threatens to derail their family holiday. Ste lays his heart on the line. (S4, ep4)

programme.title: Teen Mom UK: A New Normal
programme.desc: Sassi moves into her dream home with Darren, Amber meets a new man, Chloe and Jordan try to freshen up their relationship, while a stressed out Shannon is desperate for time on her own. (S4, ep5)

programme.title: 48 Hours: Texas Confidential
programme.desc: A report on the 1997 murder of Doris Angleton, the wife of a successful Houston, Texas bookie. Doris’ husband Bob who claimed that his brother Roger was Doris’ killer, was tried for the crime in state court and acquitted. But the case did not end there.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Perfectly Executed - Part 1
programme.desc: A report on the 1994 murders of the Rafay family -- Sultana Rafay, her husband Tariq and their autistic daughter, Basma -- focusing on the pursuit and arrest of the two suspects: Atif Rafay, the only surviving family member, and his friend Sebastian Burns

programme.title: 48 Hours: Perfectly Executed - Part 2
programme.desc: Part 2 focuses on the role of the Canadian Mounted Police in the investigation and sting operation put in place to obtain confessions from Rafay and Burns. Having taken refuge in Canada, Rafay and Burns were extradited to Seattle to face murder charges.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Black Dahlia Confidential
programme.desc: The brutal murder in 1947 of Elizabeth Short, a young, struggling actress whose body was discovered in a vacant lot in January 1947, has baffled the Los Angeles Police Department for decades

programme.title: 48 Hours: Deadly Ride
programme.desc: Jane Mixer, a student at the University of Michigan Law School in March of 1969, had just agreed to get married and had arranged a ride home to tell her parents. Her body was found in a small, rural cemetery just miles from her dorm.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Jeffrey MacDonald: Fight for Truth
programme.desc: A report on the 1970 murders of U.S. Army Doctor Jeffrey MacDonald’s pregnant wife and two daughters at their Fort Bragg home. Having served 25 years in prison for the murders, MacDonald still proclaims his innocence.

programme.title: Twin Peaks
programme.desc: A wounded Agent Cooper has a vision of a giant who gives him several clues about the murder of Laura Palmer. Shelly and Pete recover from the mill fire, but Josie and Catherine are missing.

programme.title: Twin Peaks
programme.desc: Albert determines that neither Leo nor Jacques killed Laura, but he is unable find any leads into who shot Cooper. Cooper says they must find the third man, who he believes to be Bob, the gray-haired man.

programme.title: Twin Peaks
programme.desc: Ronette is attacked in her hospital bed by an unseen person. Jean Renault, brother of Jacques and Bernard, plans to blackmail Ben Horne for the release of Audrey. Donna meets with Harold Smith, a shut-in who had befriended Laura.

programme.title: Twin Peaks
programme.desc: Leland confesses to killing Jacques Renault. Andy wants to take a new sperm count test. Rumor spreads that a food critic is coming to Twin Peaks. Jean asks Ben to set a trap for Cooper in exchange for Audrey's life.
